changed: Setup now shows inline plugin instructions using native /plugin UI (removed redundant /plugins command)
1.11.4.upgradeNotes: Plugin installation is now simpler: /setup shows 3-step instructions to add aiorg-todo via native /plugin UI.

added: Actual .mcp.json file with Ahrefs HTTP MCP server configuration

Ahrefs MCP server for SEO data, competitor traffic, and keyword research

1.11.0.upgradeNotes: Idea OS now supports Ahrefs MCP for enhanced market research. If you have an Ahrefs API key, Claude can access SEO data, competitor traffic analysis, and keyword research directly.

changed: kit-ecosystem.md now explains what aiorg.dev is vs user's product
fixed: Claude no longer confuses aiorg.dev (kit provider) with user's business

added: Interview Philosophy section in CLAUDE.md - Claude asks clarifying questions using native UI
Example triggers: validate idea (what problem?), check competitors (what space?)
1.10.0.upgradeNotes: Idea OS now asks smart questions instead of guessing. Vague requests like 'validate my idea' get clarifying questions with options.

changed: Pre-configured file permissions for working folders and ~/.aiorg/ - no more prompts

added: /whats-new command - shows latest changelog and suggests next action

added: Cross-kit recommendations section in CLAUDE.md

added: Post-upgrade greeting when starting Claude after upgrade

changed: Session start now checks for shared context (silent)

1.8.0.upgradeNotes: Idea OS now supports the AI Org kit ecosystem. Run /setup to link to a project - your validation data will be shared with other kits like Product OS and Marketing OS. Existing installations will be prompted to set up project linking during upgrade.

added: /prototype - Generate interactive Next.js prototype with realistic mock data
/prototype add - Add more views to existing prototype
/prototype data - Regenerate mock data from validation context

changed: CLAUDE.md updated with /prototype commands in Preparation section
1.7.0.upgradeNotes: New /prototype command generates a working Next.js + shadcn/ui prototype in prototype/ folder. Run it after validation to create a clickable demo for customer conversations. Uses your validation data (idea, jobs, interviews, pricing) to populate realistic mock content.
